definition:
For a real-valued function $f$ with domain $S$,
$\arg \min_{x \in S} f(x)$ is the set of elements in $S$ that achieve
the global minimum in $S$,
$${\arg \min}_{x \in S} f(x) = \{ x \in S :\, f(x) = \min_{y\in S} f(y) \}.$$

$\arg \max_{x \in S} f(x)$ is the set of elements in $S$ that achieve
the global maximum in $S$,
$${\arg \max}_{x \in S} f(x) = \{ x \in S :\, f(x) = \max_{y\in S} f(y) \}.$$
